title: I just supported a Viktor as Janna in botlane
body:
against a caitlyn and brand. Playing defensively would give them a free win in lane so we went all in and destroyed them. After lowering caitlyn's health bar from previous trades where i auto and shield myself while dodging brand spells, I took 2 points on W level 3 and flash W, ignite and autoed the enemy ad. Cait died wasting both her sums, I got first blood, didn't die, snowballed and won. Other lanes were loosing, which meant they four man roamed us bot, but Viktor and I actually carried the game. 

I don't know about yall, but I kinda like how non-marksmen champions can fill in the ADC role and come off as viable without bringing back the "ADC in 2017 LUL" meme. I'm seeing more creative games, comps, skirmishes, and team-fights due to this. Janna's passive actually enhances Viktor's ability to kite, and her shield + disengages give him more time to spam his spells. They are both champs who annoy you because they always seems to be faster than you, put them together in a lane as partners and see what happens. 

After hitting Diamond in NA, I got sick of the game and didn't play much. Currently, I'm in Korea enjoying league because the games here are a lot more creative and I'm exposed to new play styles. 
{{sticker:sg-kiko}} 


Also, 
I know everyone thinks janna is a easy shield-bot champion that's broken but I see her as a broken champion that can be beyond god-like broken if you perfect her mechanics (which imo is harder than you think, I've flash tornadoed a predicted kaisa ult before. Janna can be obnoxious). 
Her early damage is good, so she can be played aggressively. When games end in a 15-20min stomp, more often than not, I do more damage than my ADC and MId. Meta slaves who play janna in a brain-dead-shield-bot manner might play her well, but please, don't group us janna mains together with them. True Janna mains are disgusting human beings that have ascended those fools and the LP system (I know this because I am one myself)

Yeah, I've been thinking: how do you auto and dodge spells at a time?
You walk sideways. Enemy shoots a skillshot. You stop moving by auto attacking so his prediction is off and you dodge the skillshot.

Haha relevant to the topic actually. Ye I know, but once we got that lead after outplaying them and was smashing lane, the enemy sent their fed camille jg and yasuo who won his lane to make a 2 v 4 on us and we still won those fights. The camille jg was really fed (i'm talking about a 5/0/1 kda) and our yi jg was pretty much out of the game cuz he had his red buffs stolen twice, and got killed multiple times. Maybe they just weren't good, but in those 2 v 4 fights, I really felt like the movement speed & Spam spells synergy between viktor and janna was pretty good. I swear after his Q augment + my passive, viktor moved faster than the travel speed of brands Q, maybe i'm exaggerating. And at that point viktor pretty much has a shield the whole time from his Q and my E. He also prioritized and made the most out of his lichbane cd, enough till the point where i got arden to buff his autos and latter Q.  Regardless, I just had viktor as my adc for the first time and it was incredibly fun.

>They need kit changes to be viable.

They are viable, they're just not mandatory. They actually have *competition* in bot lane now, but they're still being picked.

That said, changes to make them slightly more independent and in line with other classes would be a good idea.

They are being picked because (shocker) people actually like playing as them.

But it cant be denied that in this early game snowball meta, marksmen are more of an hindrance than an asset.

According to http://champion.gg/statistics/#?roleSort=ADC&sortBy=general.playPercent&order=descend (not the best site, admittedly), marksman are still being played in their meta lane in 92% of games in Plat+

I'm not really buying "people pick them because they like playing as them." They might pick them because they're used to it, or they don't know what else to pick, but it seems that the marksman in bot lane is still more mandatory (or at least viable) than not right now. They have some competition and people are seeing some success, but that beats having them completely mandatory in bot lane with no competition whatsoever which was the case before the huge overhaul.

Shocker, but some of us like some variety in our laning. Even the support role has more variety than the bot lane carry role.

If you're going to insult me, at least base it in reality because I'm at least drawing from personal experience here.

The issue, as you've pointed out, is that you have to play aggressive if you're not going as a marksman bot lane.  There's just no other option.  This in turn means that you _really_ need to know what you're doing to make it work, otherwise you'll just die a bunch of stupid deaths and lose lane anyway.

FWIW, Ziggs is a lot of fun bot in place of a marksman, provided you have a support like Janna who has really good defensive ability.  Swain can be fun too if you're really good with him (he actually makes a good support with the right marksman too).

Also, entirely agreed on Janna.  She's one of those who it's easy to play at a basic level, but hard to play really well.  I don't play her much anymore (got distracted by TK when he came out, then lost interest in playing support for a while, and now mostly play tanky supports), but when I did I used to dumbfound people by using my ult to cut off enemies who were escaping (got a triple on her once because my ADC didn't follow up on me shoving the enemy bot lane and jungler under turret).  Making stuff like that work is not easy, and really does take skill.
Nah, you have to play aggressive no matter what your lane partner picked. Passive support play is a joke.

I meant the lane in general has to play aggressive, not the support specifically.  You're right you pretty much have to play aggressive as a support no matter what, but if you're playing something other than a marksman as the main person in lane, you can't just sit back and farm while your support fields enemy attacks for you, or you're going to lose.

I always preferred Viktor bottom over Viktor middle, but after they gutted his ultimate, it's been hard to appreciate him as a champ. Cool story though.

Pretty much any ranged damage dealer (or in some cases melee like {{champion:82}} {{champion:39}} {{champion:157}} ) can be viably played bot now I'd say. Support has always been the deciding factor.

ADCs that need 3 items to spike typically need 25+ min at the least to reach that spike as the previous patch delayed that spike by 900 gold. Picking a champion bot that spikes harder at 1-2 items gives your team a sizable advantage which is all the more relevant when games last less than 25 min on average. Exactly why {{champion:236}} {{champion:21}} {{champion:81}} are strong for example while {{champion:29}} {{champion:222}} {{champion:18}}  are weak.

Personally I actually like this change for botlane since you still have at least some viable ADCs, but stuff like Vlad/Ziggs/Yasuo, etc. will likely become viable as bot laners. I do think some of the ADCs that can only go crit and aren't even good with stormrazor should get some buffs though just to make it feel less punishing to play them.
